page.title: 11Fakenham Clubs and Societies
page.content: {The Fakenham Society}has 70 members and offers a balanced programme of music and the arts, literature, natural history and other matters of local interest.{The Evening Women's {Institute:}started (1972) for those who can't get to daytime meetings. 25 members (aged 25 - 65+) meet for 2hrs. on 2nd Wednesday of every month except August. Speakers, demonstrators, discussions, refreshments and time to chat. Exchange visits with other W.I.s and women's clubs, trips to places of local interest. Keen interest in local affairs, events and charities. Aim: to provide a happy, friendly meeting place where new ideas and skills can be learned.{Workers' Education {Association:}organises Autumn and Spring courses on educational and environmental issues. Summer trips are held to study local environment.
